column4: I dont know how to load the GUI,... I just installed the latest version of Ubuntu....   how do I get to the GUI???
xinit
type xinit in the terminal...
then you prob. need to reconfigure xorg.conf
how do I reconfigure it?
just aksed some one. w8 amte
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
i just googled it
np :)
did it work?
I seem to have found how to edit it... but the file is empty?
what is empty? did you reconfigure it?
after teh reconfigure i think you need to restart. try that. and have sjovan: infront of the text, so the msg gets highlited
ahhh sorry... didnt know :)
the root login is the one I made the "user" from when I installed correct?
its working now... I just hope I can get my Drivers to work for my ATI Radeon 1600     :)
Iam so excited :) LOL   I been kinda drinking... and cant wait to run something other then windows!!!!
well if you are drinking... why are you playing with your computer? you should be out getting some chicks...
lol my chick is next to me... watchin TV>.... I am about to go take a "break" but before I do I wanna make sure my drivers work
well, go to town and play some pool then :D

i went ahead to the restricted drivers... and enabled my card... it installed a bunch of stuff.... now it tells me to reboot.... but last time I did that it messed up the HZ..... is there anyway to make sure it doesnt change the HZ???
i don't know. maby you installed the wrong drivers. but if it don't work just: cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf-bak before you do anything
The thing went out of the HZ again and I cant see whats happening
did you make a backup of xorg as i told you?
